raw_text:
Mourinho defiant on Chelsea form
 
 Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho has insisted that Sir Alex Ferguson and Arsene Wenger would swap places with him.
 
 Mourinho's side were knocked out of the FA Cup by Newcastle last Sunday before seeing Barcelona secure a 2-1 Champions League first-leg lead in the Nou Camp. But he denied his club was suffering a dip in form which league rivals Arsenal and Manchester United could exploit. "They cannot speak to us about blips because they're not in a better position than us," Mourinho said. "Do they want to change positions with us? We are top of the league by nine points and in the Carling Cup final. "The only thing they can say they are in a better position than us in is the FA Cup. "In the Champions League all three teams can either go through or go out but the one team that is in the best position is still Chelsea."
 
 Mourinho said it was important to keep his team's results in perspective. "Don't try to put pressure on me because I am never under pressure," he warned. "We have lost one important game this week - at Newcastle - and we're out of the FA Cup but I don't think a defeat in a first-leg tie is a real defeat. We are just 2-1 down at half-time." Asked if his Chelsea honeymoon was now over, Mourinho replied: "I have had 20 years of honeymoons with my wife. "The day that this club is not happy with me is the day that I go."
llama3.2:1b: Jose Mourinho claims Chelsea's form has not dipped and says Arsenal and Manchester United will be trying to exploit the situation in future matches.
llama3.2:3b: Jose Mourinho said he and two other managers - Sir Alex Ferguson and Arsene Wenger - would swap places because Chelsea was in better form than their clubs, despite being knocked out of the FA Cup and losing a Champions League match. He denied his team's recent form was in decline and warned against putting pressure on him, saying Chelsea had many advantages, including being top of the league by nine points.
gemma2:2b:
Jose Mourinho maintains that Chelsea's performance is strong despite recent losses. He argues that his team remains in a superior position compared to rivals like Arsenal and Manchester United, particularly considering their top-of-league status in the Premier League and progress in the Carling Cup final. 
Mourinho downplays the significance of early setbacks, emphasizing they should not define the team's current trajectory.  He asserts he has a long history with success and confidence in his ability to lead Chelsea.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Chelsea's manager Jose Mourinho denied claims that he would swap places with Sir Alex Ferguson or Arsene Wenger in the Premier League, but admitted his team were still top of the league and could potentially win the Carling Cup. He maintained that losing a game this week was enough to give Mourinho an unfair advantage, but added that Chelsea's situation in the Champions League final and FA Cup would not prevent them from winning their most recent competition. Mourinho also said he had 20 years of "honeymoons" with his wife, adding that he believed they were still going strong despite the current Premier League results.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho dismisses suggestions he might be on a downward trend, noting his team's form improves over rivals like Arsenal and Manchester United. Chelsea leads in both league standings and the Champions League group stages, but Mourinho emphasizes their current position remains strong despite recent setbacks, particularly in the FA Cup against Newcastle.
qwen2.5:3b: Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho insisted he and Manchester United's Ferguson or Arsenal's Wenger would swap clubs if their rivals were in a better position, despite Chelsea being knocked out of FA Cup by Newcastle and losing to Barcelona in Champions League. Mourinho defended his team's league position (top by 9 points) and Champions League performance, emphasizing that only one team can progress from the first leg tie, with Chelsea still in the best position. He also stressed the importance of not putting pressure on him and dismissing suggestions of a honeymoon being over at Chelsea.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize the given text about Mourinho's decision to swap his position with the team. Let me start by reading through the text carefully to understand the key points.

First, Mourinho supports Ferguson and Wenger swapping positions with him. He's been in Chelsea for a long time, having led them since 2010. The text mentions that last Sunday, their side lost to Newcastle in the FA Cup, which helped them secure a strong first-leg lead against Barcelona. However, Mourinho said he wasn't worried about his team's form slipping away because they are still on top of the league and play in the Carling Cup final.

He also highlighted that only Chelsea can be seen as in a better position than them in the league after the final. The text emphasizes the importance of maintaining their win records to avoid pressure, mentioning only one loss this week. Mourinho expressed that he's not ready for a defeat right away because his wife has had 20 years of marriage with him.

Alright, so I need to capture all these points concisely without any explanations or formatting. Let me make sure I include the main ideas: Mourinho supports swapping, they won against Newcastle, secure a strong first-leg lead, Chelsea is still top of league, and his wife has had 20 years together.
</think>

mourinho supports Ferguson and Wenger swapping positions with him, claims he's not worried about form slipping. Chelsea won against Newcastle in the FA Cup, securing Barcelona' 2-1 Champions League first-leg lead. Chelsea remains on top of the league at half-time after a loss to Newcastle. Mourinho expressed no pressure since he's never under it and hasn't faced a team slip yet.
tinyllama:1.1b:
Mouriño defiant on Chelsea form
Chelsea Bossi, who plays for Portuguese side FC Porto, has expressed his dissatisfaction with his team's recent results and downplayed the possibility of a dip in form. The defender claimed that Arsenal and Manchester United are better positioned than his team, the No. 8 Porto, in the domestic and European leagues respectively. He also dismissed suggestions that his side was experiencing a decline due to under-performance, saying they were only 2-1 down at half-time during their Champions League first-leg tie against Newcastle. Nevertheless, Porto boss Nuno Gomes remains optimistic about his team's chances and believes that the 20th anniversary season of his wife's "honey moon" will help boost morale.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Mourinho defiant on Chelsea form - Sir Alex Ferguson and Arsene Wenger would swap places with him; Jose Mourinho has insisted that his team is not suffering a dip in form. Mourinho's side were knocked out of the FA Cup by Newcastle last Sunday before seeing Barcelona secure a 2-1 Champions League first-leg lead in the Nou Camp. But he denied his club is struggling and maintained they are top of the league.
phi:2.7b: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho denied any dip in form, despite being knocked out of the FA Cup by Newcastle last Sunday. He insisted that he and his team would remain top of the league and could learn from other teams' blips. Mourinho also maintained a positive attitude towards his relationship with the media and his wife.
orca-mini:3b: Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho has dismissed suggestions that his side is experiencing a blip in form, insisting that he and his team are in a better position than their league rivals Arsenal and Manchester United. Despite seeing his side lose to Newcastle in the FA Cup and seeing Barcelona secure a 2-1 Champions League first-leg lead in the Nou Camp, Mourinho stressed that his club is currently top of the Premier League by nine points and in the Carling Cup final. He also emphasized that his team remains in a positive frame of mind despite the results.
hermes3:3b: Mourino insists Chelsea not experiencing form dip, despite FA Cup loss & Champions League setback.

chatgpt-4o-latest: Jose Mourinho dismissed concerns over Chelsea's form, insisting that Arsenal and Manchester United would trade places with his team. Despite being knocked out of the FA Cup by Newcastle and trailing Barcelona 2-1 in the Champions League first leg, Mourinho emphasized that Chelsea remained nine points clear in the league and had reached the Carling Cup final. He rejected claims of a slump, stating that all three English teams still had a chance in the Champions League but Chelsea was in the best position. Mourinho downplayed pressure, viewing the Barcelona loss as only a halftime setback, and asserted his confidence in his tenure at Chelsea.
stablelm2:1.6b: Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho denies a dip in his team's form and claims they are better than Arsenal, Manchester United, and Newcastle. Despite losing an important game against Newcastle, he remains confident about their position in the league and Carling Cup final. Mourinho urges to keep results in perspective and states that Chelsea is the only one in a better position than rivals in both competitions.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Jose Mourinho, Chelsea's manager, maintains his team's form remains strong despite recent setbacks in losing to Newcastle in the FA Cup and trailing Barcelona 2-1 in their Champions League first-leg match. He asserts that Arsenal and Manchester United rivals are not in better positions than Chelsea, who lead the league by nine points and are set to face Barcelona in the second leg of the Champions League. Mourinho emphasizes he is never under pressure, dismisses a defeat against Newcastle as merely a "2-1 down at half-time" situation, and compares his managerial career to 20 years of marital bliss.
reference: "The only thing they can say they are in a better position than us in is the FA Cup."They cannot speak to us about blips because they're not in a better position than us," Mourinho said."In the Champions League all three teams can either go through or go out but the one team that is in the best position is still Chelsea.""We have lost one important game this week - at Newcastle - and we're out of the FA Cup but I don't think a defeat in a first-leg tie is a real defeat.Mourinho's side were knocked out of the FA Cup by Newcastle last Sunday before seeing Barcelona secure a 2-1 Champions League first-leg lead in the Nou Camp.Mourinho said it was important to keep his team's results in perspective.
